34
Ontological Engineering
OWL and Description Logic
•
A family of logic based Knowledge Representation formalisms
–
Descendants of semantic networks and KL-ONE
–
Describe domain in terms of concepts (classes), roles (relationships) and 
individuals
•
Specific languages characterised by the constructors and axioms used to assert knowledge 
about classes, roles and individuals.
•
Example: ALC (the least expressive language in DL that is propositionally closed)
– Constructors: boolean (and, or, not)
– Role restrictions
•
Distinguished by:
–
Formal semantics (typically model theoretic)
•
Decidable fragments of FOL
•
Closely related to Propositional Modal & Dynamic Logics
–
Provision of inference services
•
Sound and complete decision procedures for key problems
•
Implemented systems (highly optimised)
